Detailed Description

An AZURE group.

In R-Matrix theory, levels are grouped according to their values. There is one R-/A-Matrix, and thus one T-Matrix, for each group. A JGroup object holds vectors of ALevel and AChannel objects.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

JGroup::JGroup ( NucLine  nucLine  ) 

This constructor is used when a group is created from an entry in the nuclear input file.

JGroup::JGroup ( double  j,
int  pi 
)

This constructor is used when a group is created from specified values of spin and parity.

int JGroup::IsChannel ( AChannel  channel  ) 

This function tests if a given channel already exists in the vector of AChannel objects. If the channel exists the position of the channel in the vector is returned, otherwise the function returns 0.

bool JGroup::IsInRMatrix (  )  const

Returns true if the group is to be included in the A-/R-Matrix calculation, otherwise returns false. A group may specify only a bound state for external capture, but may not correspond to an R-Matrix state (i.e. subthreshold state).

int JGroup::IsLevel ( ALevel  level  ) 

This function tests if a given level already exists in the vector of ALevel objects. If the level exists the position of the level in the vector is returned, otherwise the function returns 0.

int JGroup::NumChannels (  ) 

Returns the number of channels in the AChannel vector.

int JGroup::NumLevels (  )  const

Returns the number of levels in the ALevel vector.
